thread.title: Northfield football forfeits 4 games due to ineligible player
thread.title_full: Northfield football forfeits 4 games due to ineligible player

title: Northfield football forfeits 4 games due to ineligible player
text:
Northfield football forfeits 4 games due to ineligible player 
By Eric Dutkiewicz - 21Alive Northfield Norsemen football October 8, 2015 Updated Oct 8, 2015 at 11:51 PM EDT 
WABASH, Ind. (21Alive) - Northfield's undefeated season ended Wednesday, but it was not on the football field. 
The Norsemen forfeited four games for playing with an ineligible player. 
Digital Daily â€“ subscribe to our daily newsletter 
School officials say they discovered the boy played in four games while putting together the sectional roster, and notified the Indiana High School Athletic Association. 
The forfeits drop Northfield's record from 7-0 to 3-4. The Norse's average margin of victory for the 7 games is nearly 22 points. It is not known which games the unidentified player participated in. 
"Though this is a dismal way to wrap up an otherwise stellar run, our mistake should in no way detract from the accomplishments and hard work of these young men," Northfield athletic director Clint Davis said in a statement. 
Northfield finishes the season regular season Friday at home against Whitko, then plays in the Three Rivers Conference playoff. 
The Norse are eligible for the Class 1A sectional tournament
